docs.lead_paragraph: The state House and Senate cast opposing votes Thursday on whether to accept federal Medicaid funds to provide health insurance to as many as 400,000 low-income residents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dichter Pharmacy has become a salon and nosh stop and gift store, filled with lotions and potions aimed at the new tide of more-affluent people living in Inwood.

headline.main: A Pharmacy Provides Salves for a Community’s Spirits
headline.print_headline: A Pharmacy Provides Salves for a Community’s Spirits

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes the scene at Dichter Pharmacy and Soda Shoppe in the Inwood section of Upper Manhattan, which has become a salon and nosh stop and gift store in addition to a pharmacy; notes that the shop, which burned down in 2012, was quickly relocated and rebuilt with the help of the community.
docs.snippet: Dichter Pharmacy has become a salon and nosh stop and gift store, filled with lotions and potions aimed at the new tide of more-affluent people living in Inwood.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cities, counties and public schools, lacking the option of passing along increased costs to consumers, are drawing a line at 30 hours.

headline.main: Public Sector Cuts Part-Time Shifts to Bypass Insurance Law
headline.print_headline: Public Sector Capping Part-Time Hours to Skirt Health Care Law

docs.abstract: State and local officials say cities, counties, public schools and community colleges around country have limited or reduced work hours of part-time employees to 30 hours to avoid having to provide them with health insurance under Affordable Care Act; cuts to public sector employment could serve as powerful political weapon for Republican critics of law.
docs.snippet: Cities, counties and public schools, lacking the option of passing along increased costs to consumers, are drawing a line at 30 hours.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers say they have found new evidence that Greece's financial crisis is taking a toll on the health of its citizens, including rising rates of HIV, tuberculosis, depression and even infant deaths.

docs.lead_paragraph: A diplomat who visited the family of a Pakistani student who's been hospitalized for three months said Thursday they were relieved by details of a deal that resolves his visa and insurance issues to ensure he can stay in the U.S. and get the long-term care he needs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like most taxi drivers, Sebti Boukarit doesn't have health insurance. And because he works up to 12 hours a day, six days a week, he hasn't had much time to sign up under the nation's new health care law.

headline.main: Looking for the Uninsured? Just Hail a Taxi Driver
